two hey Scott I'm a 31-year-old College
Dropout who's been fortunate enough to

found my way into product management by

if you were a young Scott Galloway today

when you were starting your career today
and lastly
asking for a
friend what advice do you have for a

yourself you've recognized a lot of
success you've made a lot of money and
now you're not and you're facing your

Narrative of how amazing they are and

where you are right now so the first is

Wellness together right you

mobile if you will go on every interview
don't let perfect be the enemy of good

okay right now there's all these people

we're constantly thinking about ensuring

is when you flip to the credit side and

that is you start doing more for other
people and I do little things called
what a man does and that is I say okay
when visitors show up a man immediately

almost any
context and at some point I say you're

hopefully some men never do some men

what well I was just calling to check in
oh okay and he's doing something else

a
question uh that's kind of the garbage

try and find as much garbage time with

like demonstrate what I do and I'm good
